website_summaries.verdict: A great mid-range smoker that allows you to turn out mouth-watering meals with little hassle.
pros: Good build quality on oven, door, and cool touch latch
4 chrome-plated cooking racks can hold up to 80 pounds of food, and 15,400 BTUs provide plenty of power for large meals
Push-button ignition is very convenient, as is the built-in temperature gauge
cons: The wood tray in this smoker is underwhelming
Could be improved with wheels for easier transport

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall Propane/Wood Chip Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I am an elderly lady and put this smoker together by myself in about 45 minutes. Not bad for someone who is not mechanically inclined. I was going to take off a star for ease of assembly because I couldn't find where the instruction wanted me to hand the aluminum cup. I cured it twice following the instructions. Hooked up the propane, threw in apple, mesquite, and hickory wood chips and smoked me a nice piece of beef brisket. This meat came out moist and flavorful. I'll post more as I use the product. For now, I'm really happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jallie

customer_reviews.title: smoked burgers and dogs just for fun, ribs and pulled pork
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing all the time. Smoked chicken for my lunches, smoked burgers and dogs just for fun, ribs and pulled pork, stuffed peppers wrapped in bacon, etc... I removed the existing wood chip pan since it didn't really work. Placed 2 pieces of rebar over the burner so I could put a small cast iron skillet for the wood. Works much better now. Wood chips burn out too fast, I use chunks soaked in water. Also, line the bottom with aluminum foil to help keep the bottom clean. Change it out once in a while and this will last forever!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew N.

customer_reviews.title: Legitimate Smoker  GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other reviewers I added some lava rock. I also picked up ThermoPro TP-08 Wireless Remote Digital Cooking Meat Thermometer Dual Probe and those 11 inch Webber pans to replace the drip pan it comes with. I smoked two 12 pound turkeys for Thanksgiving and they turned out PERFECT. I probably could have put in another shelf and smoked something else with em that is maybe 2 to 4 inches tall. So.. just like everyone has said, this smoker is legitimate and does not cost an arm and leg like that green egg looking one or that pellet one that starts with T.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Gaston

customer_reviews.title: Cracked propane connection
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this in August but didn't have time to use it until now. We discovered that the propane connection hose leaked when it was connected to the tank so we had to purchase another to use it. I would like to send that hose back so it could be corrected but can't figure out how to get a message to the seller. The twist knob seems to have a crack in it. The drip pan is ridiculously small and have replaced it with a disposable larger throw away pan. If not for the leak in the hose, and the small drip pan it would have gotten a 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley H.

customer_reviews.title: Does not last years.
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this after 3 years of use. First impression was wow, this thing is amazing. Now after many uses, it does not hold up for very long. At one point, the bottom part caught fire and completely destoyed the bottom control. They sent me a replacement and worked fine after that. Fast forward a few months of maintaining it the way they said for me to do it and now i have to be very cautious with leaving it on unattended because the flame shoots out of the bottom like it did when it destroyed the bottom controller. Need to find another replacement smoker. Does not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian D

customer_reviews.title: Cover the holes in the chip pan with foil to avoid flare ups.
customer_reviews.text: This smoker works really well as long as you take your time and do a couple of small things during set up to make it work correctly. First. MAKE SURE YOU SEASON YOUR SMOKER. 2ND... Before you attempt to smoke anything. Take aluminum foil and cover the entire bottom of the chip pan to cover the holes, so the flames can't reach your chips. If you do not do this, then the chips will catch on fire and you will have a 400 degree grill and not a smoker. It only takes a minute or two to cover the chip pan. Once you do this, the smoker holds temperature and works great.
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: Great basic propane smoker
customer_reviews.text: I had received an electric smoker as a Christmas gift and enjoyed using it but the temperature was very difficult to control. So I replaced it with this unit and have been very pleased. Not only is it far easier to regulate the temperature with the propane, this unit has a second door that allows you refill the water pan and woodchip pan without opening the area with the meat rack which helps preserve your temperature and smoke. My only complaint was that door got slightly bent during shipping but it didnt impact its function so I kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer 1976

customer_reviews.title: Smokin' smoker!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my husband for his birthday, but it has been more of a gift for me! He has smoked salmon in it 3 times and has smoked beef and pork. Everything so far has been delicious! He is really enjoying it and has even been researching discussion boards and websites for tips and tricks (and recipes). It's become a fun (and yummy) hobby. I purchased this product at normal retail price and am reviewing it to share my experience with others who are considering purchasing this product. I have received no compensation for my review.
customer_reviews.author: Momopolize

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smoker, first time I used it was to ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome smoker, first time I used it was to smoke a turkey for Thanksgiving and this made the day much more enjoyable over the old charcoal smoker I had been using for the last few years. This sill gave the turkey the same great smokey taste with a lot less work than keeping a charcoal fire going for 7 hours. I will admit that there was as much "smokey taste" as there was with my charcoal smoker but it still does a fantastic job and like I said with much much less effort.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Cowee

customer_reviews.title: Good starter smoker
customer_reviews.text: It is a good starter. I will upgrade in the future. Cons: -Wood chip bowl allows fire to ignite the chips - use a baking sheet or frying pan -Smoke leaks out like crazy - solved with high temp caulk bead around doors Pros: - smoked 3 shoulders at one time - smoked 6 slabs of ribs at one time - i havent noticed a major amount of heat loss or propane usage
customer_reviews.author: SteveM

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good smoker for the price. You need to make a few modifications to ensure that the flame doesn't get blown out by the wind. I bought some sheet metal and cut it to size to attached to the legs. I also purchased casters that are grease and oil resistant so that it is easier to move this unit around.
customer_reviews.author: BIG AL

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I works pretty good, but hard to adjust at temperatures below 250F. I had to change out the water pan with a disposable one as the one that came with the smoker is small and messy to remove. I also had to use one of the cooking grates for the water pan so I have one less to hold meat. I also replaced the chip holder with an eight inch Lodge Cast-Iron skillet as suggested by a few reviewers. My biggest disappoint is the temperature gauge. After only two weeks it has water inside. I have had my Weber Q outside for five years and never had a problem with water getting inside the thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Bill W

customer_reviews.title: Finally the right one!
customer_reviews.text: After ordering 3 DIFFERENT smokers for my Husband's Birthday,& having to send ALL of them back,I was about to give up.Then I came across this one in a last ditch effort.Its the right size,has adjustable racks which the others did not.Its manufactured w/quality workmanship.Where the others were lightweight& cheaply made,this one is MUCH heavier& the doors are insulated,which is a BIG plus!He had a larger one made by Masterbuilt,and it lasted about 6 yrs or more w/CONSTANT use. He wanted a smaller size& loves this new one.I HIGHLY recommend the Masterbuilt brand.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect smoker for the price!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smoker based on other positive reviews and they were correct. This is an excellent backyard smoker. I found that it maintains a consistent temperature. Like others have said, this is a smoker not a grill and is meant for those days when you have time for SLOOOW cooking. I have owned the charcoal bullet type smokers and they worked well but didn't hold nearly the amount of meat this one does. Not to mention, this smoker is taller making it easier to work with. I used it this past 4th of July for a big barbecue we had and everything turned out perfect. I would strongly recommend this smoker.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Warehouse Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Bought from the warehouse as "Good Like New" not so items missing door latches, and control knob to operate the gas burner, item was also dented. After requesting a return which Amazon sent instantly. I called Masterbuilt and they were able to send parts in 4 days. Much quicker than shipping back and reordering. Used hand tools to fix dents. Only saved $17 by buying from the warehouse. Don't deal with the problems I had. Just pay the extra and get New out of the box. This is a great smoker. I would recommend this to everyone and after you smoke some meat you will smoke everything you can as often as you can!
customer_reviews.author: James P johnson

customer_reviews.title: ok out of the box, great after modifying
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot for its size. Temperature is easy to maintain once you get the hang of it. Mods: replaced smoke pan with a range grate and 8 inch cast iron pan, replaced thermometer (the one on the smoker is useless), replaced water pan with stainless steam pan, used nomex tape around the perimeter of doors for a better seal.
customer_reviews.author: buyer6060

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact Smoker
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases I have ever made. Makes smoking easy. My sister, a James Beard nominated food critic, said I had spoiled her for eating smoked meat in restaurants, even a famous smokehouse in a North Carolina that she went to shortly after eating my first brisket. Go ahead — buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher Raleigh

customer_reviews.title: We have used the smoker several times and love it! Once we got past the first use ...
customer_reviews.text: We have used the smoker several times and love it! Once we got past the first use of learning how to regular the temp, it became super easy to use. I would recommend this to anyone but especially those just learning to smoke. We also purchased a separate wireless thermometer to monitor the temp and this helped a lot!
customer_reviews.author: bnoland19

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY -- It could burn down your house
customer_reviews.text: I've had this smoker for a littler over a year. I fired it up today to start smoking some ribs. 15 minutes later I came outside to put the ribs in it and the front of the smoker was on fire. The knob had melted off and the gas line was starting to melt too. I shut off the gas tank and the fire quickly went out, but I had I waited a few more minutes the gas line would have completely melted off the smoker and likely caught fire. I'm lucky I came out when I did. I highly recommend people buy a better quality smoker that turn into a fire hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Layton

customer_reviews.title: Check check and re check box for dents or dings.then check over unit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a buddy and upon opening found dent in small door.also found hinges bent causing doors to not be squared up.also on level ground unit rocks do to being not squared.the box that unit came in was in awesome shape too.open up and see these issues makes u mad for the cost of unit.recommend going over before you keep or give as gift as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I have had this smoker for one year. It is a great BBQ smoking device. Easy to access the meats in the upper door and the separate lower door for wood chips. I have taken the advice of others and utilized the Weber drip pan 7x11 for increased water capacity. I enjoy this smokers ability to handle multiple shelves that are adjustable. Thirty inches is a plenty large capacity. I've smoked turkeys, chicken, pork roast, pork ribs. I also use a battery operated meat thermometer to test the doneness of various meats toward of cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks. Bought almost a year ago and use it often. Be prepared to install gasket material around both doors, or you won't be able to regulate temp and the smoke will leak. Buy a digital thermometer. The one in the door isn't reliable. Replace the firebox with an 8" cast iron skillet. Use wood chunks, and you'll only need to add one every hour or two. Check the water every 90 minutes. Not showing much wear. I seasoned it well before first use and keep a cover on it. Very pleased. Works well and these few tweaks, easy to use. Gets a four because the gasket and thermometer issues should be resolved by the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: David Durr

customer_reviews.title: A great smoker for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first smoker, but I really like it. I've produced some awesome beef jerky and lots of great smoked fish. The smoker is well built and since it is vertical, it takes very little room on a patio. It is not a "cold smoker", so if you want to smoke for 10 hours, look elsewhere. It is a bit challenging to keep the temps down with this smoker, but if you keep the water pan full of water and regulate the shutter in the rear, you can smoke at around 150-175 degrees on low setting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Good results with my smoker
customer_reviews.text: The Masterbuilt propane smoker yielded some very good results for my first time using a smoker. I feel having a door the sealed shut would be a great improvement. Much heat and smoke escapes around the door where it meets the grill. Also a better way to load more wood. I had to throw the wood into the container. This grill is a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Willie S.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I have dozen ribs, roasts and chickens on it all are cooked with complete control. Uses very little propane. Use a disposable aluminum pan under the meat with waste in it and clean up is much easier. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Happy mate

customer_reviews.title: So far so great!
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with a gas smoker I've given up on electrics. They only last about 2 years. I've used it 3 times- large turkey and two rib roasts. They all came out perfect. I soaked my wood chips overnight and didn't have a problem with flare ups as other reviews described. The gas tank is still showing full One review said it used a whole tank of gas for each use. He must have a leak or is kiln-ing pottery It has plenty of horse power. The lowest setting keeps it right at 180 to 210 depending on your damper setting. Don't forget to break it in as directed.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic DeCrescentis Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good performance--see review for tips
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price, good service--received mine with one latch damaged (shipping)--called Masterbuilt, they sent another immediately. Good, smoker--after much research, I believe it to be among the best. Have smoked two turkeys and a ham--very happy User needs to have a remote thermometer that provides internal meat temp as it is easy to overcook. I found the thermometer that indicates the smoker chamber temp to be off by about 15 degrees--I just compensate rather than mess with a new thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: RUST AND ROT!!
customer_reviews.text: After owning this product for approximately a year and a half, and keeping it covered throughout that entire timespan, the entire bottom tray on the inside has completely rotted through. Manufacturer will not do anything, since there's only a 1 year warranty -- and wouldn't cover in any event, since the warranty apparently doesn't cover rust/rot -- and amazon will not assist either. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: RobM

customer_reviews.title: SUPER easy to put together and even easier to use
customer_reviews.text: Why didn't I get one of these sooner?? SUPER easy to put together and even easier to use. I smoked a turkey breast on my first use and it was great. I highly recommend this to anyone interested in getting into smoking meats. My only knock is that the thermometer on the door isn't accurate, but after I did my homework on it, I bought a separate digital thermometer to monitor both meat and rack temperature. The door thermometer was consistently about 50'F more than the rack value.
customer_reviews.author: abigmeathead

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy This Product
customer_reviews.text: The regulator/heat dial broke after approximately the 5th use. The regulator was on fire. The fire is on the line connected to a propane tank. We are fortunate there was no explosion, but I did lose all my homegrown tomatoes I was smoking. Masterbuilt refused to exchange the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn S. Holscher-dobbs

customer_reviews.title: good starter smoker
customer_reviews.text: if your just getting in to smoking this propane smoker is a good start. these less expensive models are fine for doing short cooks such as chicken wings, sausages or pork loins. although you can do ribs in this smoker, longer cooking times of 4 to 8 hours ( ribs, brisket and other long cook meats) should be done in a smoker more suited to that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: PAUL D DANNER

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit for the price. Easy to assemble and operate. The burner can crank this thing up if the outside temps drop. Many times these cooker/smokers have low BTU burners that limit your use if the temps drop under 60 degrees F. I read some other reviews and put the casters on the legs for easy rolling. Do this, the holes are easy to drill and I bolted some 2 inch casters on which cost under $3 each. Time to start BBQing.
customer_reviews.author: Banditrider

customer_reviews.title: Smoker
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these, one at the cabin and one at home. It works great and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great smoker at a fare price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Currently quite disappointed and considering returning the smoker
customer_reviews.text: Two words: FLARE UPS. Even at the lowest temperature, wood cannot be placed in the flame disk bowl without protection. It will flare up immediately unless it is wrapped in foil or placed in some other container. I suspect I can mitigate this by wrapping the bowl in foil, but I shouldn't have to modify this for it to smoke my wood correctly. I was excited to have a real smoker because I've been making do with my propane grill for a very long time. Currently quite disappointed and considering returning the smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Rots out quick
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years it rotted out where you put the chips. Poor construction. Always under cover in winter too. OK smoker but need better materials. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Desmo

customer_reviews.title: I expected to buy another one based on my previous good experience. The nice thing is that I read ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd smoker I've owned from this exact model. It lasted a couple of years and I used it a lot. So, I expected to buy another one based on my previous good experience. The nice thing is that I read a few suggestions from others as to how to use this smoker more efficiently. I have already incorporated the changes on this unit (adding the caster wheels on the legs). This is a great smoker for the price. It consistently does the job and delivers delicious meats each time. No complaints from me.
customer_reviews.author: stan stallbaumer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Fire Danger.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend as a gift. He set it up according to the directions, started it and we went inside. Within less than an hour the unit started on fire and burned a hole in his deck. Thankfully the entire house didn't catch on fire. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Marda Deane

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I was slightly disappointed that there was some small damage. could very well have come from shipping so I'm not blaming Masterbuilt. The hinge to the bottom door was broken off, the weld had snapped. Easy enough for me to fix. I am upset how ever that the control knob for the gas was missing. Most of the local stores carry replacement knobs but it isn't easy finding the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I saw some people's negative comments about putting it together or food tasting funny. It comes with a manual for a reason
customer_reviews.text: This smoker is the truth, I saw some people's negative comments about putting it together or food tasting funny. It comes with a manual for a reason, it clearly walks you step by step through putting it together and it only took me 20 minutes to do it and people CURE your smoker before using it, it will burn off the chemicals used when it was built. I also added ceramic briquettes to the wood pan to help the wood burn slower.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Love it and did my first smoke it cam out great, since then i used it one more time with pork spare ribs. Now i know what i was missing. The machine is great and does a good job, my only worry is the wood chip pan, it seemed like it got a little warped and the paint kind of have marks on it. it does not matter because i put foil over it anyway. I emailed customer service and they wanted a picture. Thats the last i heard about it and i am not going to worry about that i can live with that. Overall i would recomend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: A "cool" smoker
customer_reviews.text: A nice smoker. My first attempt was six racks of ribs. Excellent. My second attempt was a brisket and corned beef. After 13 hours, the internal temp was only 157 degrees. Placing an oven thermometer in the unit showed the problem: The smoker's builtin thermometer reports 157 degrees as 205 degrees. The brisket was ...disappointing. I highly suggest using a non-Masterbuilt thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Crackpot

customer_reviews.title: I am sold on this smoker as well as a convert to this style of cooking
customer_reviews.text: This was my first smoker and I have to say it's a dream! Easy to put together and easy to use. The only thing I had to change was to put a cast iron skillet in it for the wood chips because the plate that comes with it tend to catch the chips on fire. I live in Cal. and it appears that there is no brisket this time of year in the entire state, so my first meat was a Tri Tip that came out great! My family loves the taste that the smoker gave to the meat and I look forward to cooking more with this.smoker!
customer_reviews.author: R Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Value for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: Best Value for the money,do not regret it! I built a rolling stand to roll it in and out of the garage with the propane tank on the rolling stand. This has surpassed my expectations! Easy to use! Does not consume a lot of propane and works very well. I would suggest buying a digital thermometer for the inside temperature and inserting it through the small hole in the smoke adjustment door!
customer_reviews.author: rayboy59

customer_reviews.title: Good buy-great starter smoker
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. He took it out the box immediately and put it together. He's a novice at smoking meat. I read all the reviews, which I found very helpful. Took the advice and bought an iron pan for the chips. It assembled easily. As a beginner he was appreciative of the propane source of fuel. And this was a cyber Monday sale! the price was a real bargain and I saved $57 on shipping. All we need now is to practice and learning to perfect the smoking process.
customer_reviews.author: DWillia

customer_reviews.title: Bad temp control
customer_reviews.text: I've used the smoker about 20 times now. It's a well built unit and I love the 2 door set up however the burner and gas control is garbage. On a 70° day I can only get it down to 300°-350. The valve does very little to regulate the flame. I contacted masterbilt and they replied once asking for more information and when I supplied the info , I never heard back. I ended up fitting a weber grill control valve on the unit and now have better temp control. I would not recommend this unit to anyone. Spend some more money and buy a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Cbier

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker some minor issue but good quality overall.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this smoker about 6 times now and love it overall. I would have opted for the model that is a size larger if I had to do it again. My temperature gauge has been broken and I never received a response from amazon. I would defiantly choose propane also and researched various models and am happy with this choice. It's not a high end smoker but I use it once a month on average and fill it up and works great. If your not wanting to spend more than two hundred for a smoker then you will be more than pleased with this model. Just wish the temperature gauge worked.
customer_reviews.author: David Eldridge

customer_reviews.title: Great after a few modifications
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and so knew to put on door seal,use the disposable foil pan for water and lava rocks with a cast iron skillet for wood chips. After that, it is a great smoker! Rusts very easily, so we also bought a good cover, but won't be leaving it in the shed over winter or we won't get to use it next year! So far smoked pork butt and salmon. Both met with rave reviews. Hard to keep temperature below 250, so had to put up with that rather than the desired 170 to smoke the fish.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: Good size, easy to use. Watch out for your valve...
customer_reviews.text: Had to have the valve swapped out by Masterbuilt. If yours comes with an aluminum valve, you need to have it swapped for a brass fitting. The aluminum valve doesn't restrict the propane enough, my temp wouldn't get below 385°- 400°F. Once the new part came in, I was able to get my temp at and below 200°F
customer_reviews.author: Alex in 505

customer_reviews.title: smooookkkeee.......are you smoking yet if not you shouljd be.......i am smoking now!
customer_reviews.text: smokes like a champ! best purchase ive ever made! very effiecent on propane! i use it every chance i get and it always preforms as expected! takes some practice but now that ive used it several times cooking with it is brainless but it in and leave alone!
customer_reviews.author: C802

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the smoker twice and it has worked great. I put it together in probably under 30 minutes and then seasoned it. It leaks a little smoke but not to much. You can add wood chips without opening the main door and adjusting the temperature is quite easy. You can smoke several products at once. I looked at the smokers at some of the other retail stores and they were not as sturdy or as well made as this one. This is a great smoker for the food enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: albert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Smoker!
customer_reviews.text: So very pleased with this smoker. It was quick and easy to assemble. I use an iron skillet over the burner for the wood chips as others have suggested. They must have upgraded the included thermometer since some previous reviews about it. I use afor both chamber temperature and internal meat temperature and it showed the exact temp as the thermometer on the door. I expect many more great meals from this model.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great, convenient smoker for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed using this smoker. I have done 3 briskets and 4 Turkey Breasts in it so far. It contains heat well and is pretty well built. A very good deal for the money. The 30" size very easily can contain a lot of meat. The thermometer is accurate. If there is any negative, I would say that the water bowl is a bit shallow and required you to check it about every hour. However, separating the burner and water dish from the main cabinet is helpful. I resolved the shallow dish issue by adding a pie pan with water as a reserve. I have found the key to good Q is moisture.
customer_reviews.author: A. Siddiqi

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to keep temp below 250
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this smoker except I had been unable to keep the temp closer to 220 degrees. Contacting the company, I was told that this smoker was not designed to keep the temp that low. However, I solved the problem by leaving the door slightly open. Would have given an overall 5 rating but for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: mgregg1256

customer_reviews.title: Bought new in 2017, bottom totally burned out in 2019
customer_reviews.text: Bottom of the unit has burned out, as well as the smoker pan in only occasional use. Lasted only two years, my last Masterbuilt smoker.
customer_reviews.author: J. Farr

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Massive malfunction caused a propane leak at the bottom of the burner, major conflagration, caught it in time and did not have it near any structures. Buyer beware. FYI - I followed another review and updated the rocks, door seal, etc. and could still not get consistent temps.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very good smoker, crummy thermometer!
customer_reviews.text: I love the smoker, does a real good job. But after about 10 uses, I went out today and the thermometer if frozen at 300degree mark. Kind of makes it hard to cook properly and confidently. I just went out and checked it thermometer says 375* and I can hold my hand on sides without any problem maybe inside is actually half the temp the therm says. Gonna try and make it work cooking blind today. Went to Home Depot all they had was grill thermometers. Why make a great smoker and put a crummy thermometer in it. Lucky I like the size, 2 door concept, and the smoker as a whole, otherwise it would be less stars.
customer_reviews.author: golfdawg53

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker.
customer_reviews.text: The smoker works great but there were no directions in the box I had to look up the assembly instructions online
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Pinkard

customer_reviews.title: Nice little smoker.
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker for the price. I would advise to use a cast iron skillet for the chips much like others have posted. Easier clean up and a better burn on the chips. The thermometer broke on the first time I closed the door on my first rack of ribs. I'd suggest a good digital thermometer as a back up. It holds smoke really well and its really easy to assemble. It surprising fits A TON of food. I smoked 4 racks of ribs and split them in half to fit and had not problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Better than Traeger Pellet
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Masterbuilt electric smoker and then the Traeger pellet smoker and this propane version is the bee's knee's in comparison. It holds the temp inside better than any smoker I have ever worked with. The clean up was a breeze since the shelves slide out. I would recommend, like others have, to insulate the smoker around the door with some fireplace sealer. It will be worth it down the line. Assembly took 30min.
customer_reviews.author: PugetSmith

customer_reviews.title: Catches fire.. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this smoker for just about a year now and only used it less than 10 times.. And it caught fire.. Almost taking my deck with it. Be warned not a great product.. It melted off the face of the knobs, burnt the cables and tried to get the propane tank too..
customer_reviews.author: rebecca pierce

customer_reviews.title: Wood pan needs modified
customer_reviews.text: The wood chip pan has holes in it and will catch the wood on fire burning the bottom rack. I took a hammer and smashed them down flat.Works great but surely the manufacturing company should have corrected this before selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Just facts

customer_reviews.title: where there's smoke.....
customer_reviews.text: Not sure yet. Put together last night. Easy. Added caster wheels as recommended by another reviewer. Fired it up last night and with all the smoke billowing out from the closed doors I'm surprised neighbors didn't call the fire department! I guess I will have to follow other recommendations to add some kind of sealant which is ridiculous as the maker should make the doors more air tight.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, easy to assemble, and works well. Exellent value for the price too. I'd buy this style over electric. I have an electric and gas is cheaper to run if you find a place to fill tanks for a good price. Plus you can bring this anywhere (well anywhere you want to haul a 60lb smoker + tank)
customer_reviews.author: ritebuy

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well, but you have to place a skillet ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well, but you have to place a skillet in where the wood chips should go. The wood chip pan is too close to fire and they will burn even if wrapped. Put. Skillet on top and throw chips in there. Works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Smokers...you gotta have it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, how my husband loves this! He has tried a variety of meats and everything comes out perfect. In our 30+ years of marriage, he has owned quite a few smokers and so far this is his favorite! People always request that he throw something on the smoker and he likes that it requires very little attention while doing it's job!! I would definitely buy this again. It did come without the internal grates, but they were shipped right away after we called.
customer_reviews.author: padams

customer_reviews.title: a great smoker
customer_reviews.text: this smoker is great; even for the beginner. Well constructed so that you can easily use it. the top door opens to a roomy area where you put the food. and the handy bottom door easily allows one to add wood, water or adjust the flames. We hooked a gage on the propane tank to monitor the usage- which was moderate. Clean-up is somewhat easy. And The manual gives good cooking time advice. We really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie steele

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic smoker
customer_reviews.text: Able to keep a nice low 225 degrees for most meats as well as easily getting up to 325 for smoking turkey for thanksgiving. The best turkey I've had. Forget frying, smoking is way better and our 16 pounder was done in 2 hours 15 minutes. Everything comes out so juicy when smoked low and slow. Others have commented about replacing the wood pan with a cast iron pan, but I think the provided pan works just fine. Couldn't be happier with this smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M Campo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome smoker !!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome smoker !!! Works great, sturdy construction, easy assembly, no need to purcgase the larger more expensive model , this one has adjustable shelves and can handle just about anything I will ever preserve by smoking !!!
customer_reviews.author: XX-MAN

customer_reviews.title: The line into the burner caught on fire and melted ...
customer_reviews.text: The line into the burner caught on fire and melted the front off the unit. Looking at more negative reviews it appears the same thing happened to a lot of people. It also got extremely rusty even with the cover and keeping most moisture away from the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Needed new parts and additional supplies to run correctly...
customer_reviews.text: Husband likes this smoker, however had to order a replacement regulator from the company as the original one didn't work. Also had to purchase "heat fabric tape" stuff to go around the door openings as they didn't close tight enough allowing smoke to roll out everywhere! After the new parts and fabric tape it works much better.
customer_reviews.author: SuperMom

customer_reviews.title: put together fairly fast and easy, good instructions
customer_reviews.text: 1st one came damaged, NP on exchange. put together fairly fast and easy, good instructions. heats up quick and is easy to regulate temps and is fairly light to move. Adding wheels would be a good idea if you plan to use it on a hard surface etc.
customer_reviews.author: wired

customer_reviews.title: Easy to load.
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job. We have smoked trout, duck, pheasant, sausage, prime rib, jerky, hot dogs and cheese and they all turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: Patty E.

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker ...so easy
customer_reviews.text: Great smoker !!! I have a webber smoker and have used it sme what in the last few years Just because it takes a long time to set up cook in it and clean it after that. With the masterbuilt it is completely different story, turn it on and you are good to go..... So easy and easy to clean too. Now I'll have smoked meat on the table more often specially with the rub I make....
customer_reviews.author: D. Omex

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product
customer_reviews.text: The smoker was very simple to assemble. I was a little concerned about the complaints concerning the thermometer and leaky doors, but I didn't find either of those to be issues with my smoker. During the seasoning process, I placed an oven thermometer inside the unit to compare the built-in thermometer with the oven thermometer. The readings were identical. The doors fasten very securely. I had very little leakage around the doors. This is a very nice unit and I would not hesitate to recommend it. I smoked some baby back ribs and they were awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Assembled easily although could not find where the drip cup is supposed to be. The push button ignition does not work so I called Masterbuilt and it is going to take 2 months to get a replacement and they definitely lack customer service but for the price and the results of the food you won’t be sorry with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dsweet

customer_reviews.title: good little smoker, great design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this upright because it had shelves, is lp not briquette powered so can regulate heat easily without repeated monitoring. It works great, have had a lot of food compliments. Does best with ribs slow cooking, others such as chicken seems to dry out quicker. Would have been nice to have a larger water and wood bins for less refill. Would buy again, as was priced reasonably.
customer_reviews.author: road_warrior

customer_reviews.title: Good starter smoker
customer_reviews.text: Only had this a few months and have smoked thirty products. I like the smoker, I just can't keep the temp below 200, which is not noted on any of the company propaganda. Had I known, I would have made a different purchase. Still for 179.00 a good started smoker. The company staff have been very good on fielding questions.
customer_reviews.author: Carole R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't get better than this
customer_reviews.text: I have one myself and we sent our son one this year. He has been using it a lot and it does the job well. Holds the temperature nicely, lots of room for briskets, turkeys, etc. This is an awesome smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Ulli Rhine

customer_reviews.title: Smoking hot
customer_reviews.text: Son and son-in-law love their new smokers. They are both great BBQ'ers, so adding the smoker to the mix just makes the meal so much tastier.
customer_reviews.author: Dione Smith

customer_reviews.title: ... as a Marine stationed in Virginia and made some awesome BBQ. I bought one as soon as I ...
customer_reviews.text: My son purchased one as a Marine stationed in Virginia and made some awesome BBQ. I bought one as soon as I got home and am really happy with it as a novice smoker it made it easy. Applied a few tricks of the trade by removing the water tray and adding Walmart aluminum which kept meat moist and temp down.Excellent product and great transaction.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.Brown

customer_reviews.title: A BIG 5 STAR
customer_reviews.text: I chose a 5 star rating; because I purchased this Masterbuilt 20051311 GS30D 2-Door Propane Smoker and it has done the job as it was suppose to do! I smoked a large Turkey, pork ribs, sausage . The meat came out moist and juicie with great smoke taste. Second reason: I prefer a propane gas burner over electric heat, just like cooking over a wood stove!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hurst

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well
customer_reviews.text: Very nice smoker for the price,works well .Does exactly what it is designed to do, smoke meat.Dont fall into the hype that you need to do this or that to improve it,sure it MIGHT make it better, but it works just fine out of the box.As with any thing you get what you pay for,you cant buy a BMW for the same amount of money as a Kia.For the price this is a decent smoker.
customer_reviews.author: L.T.

customer_reviews.title: If secondary burner burns out . do not attempt to use the burner. Replace burner or replace unit.
customer_reviews.text: Masterbuilt has a defect in the secondary burner. Can potentially flash fire . Do not attempt to stand in front of the pit. Could cause third degree burns if not wearing Proper PPE
customer_reviews.author: ronald ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I read most of the Amazon reviews before selecting the Masterbuilt. The assembly directions were clear and easy to follow, a plus for me. The manual had plenty of information to begin smoking. I've had three very successful smokes with no info other than that in the manual,also a plus. I now have a couple of books on smoking and expect the Masterbuilt to continue to make me happy.
customer_reviews.author: Don McCay

customer_reviews.title: I love it and my wife loves me using it
customer_reviews.text: I love it and my wife loves me using it. Had a bad regulator initially, but the great customer service sent me a new one right away. While on the phone, I had a great conversation with insider tips on how to make it better. Best tip was to use to make mac and cheese, I did, and it was brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Will Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this smoker after talking to an owner of one just like it. The gas version makes it very easy to control temperature. I am very new to this smoking thing, so the food I turn out is still a work in progress, but the smoker gives me everything I could ask for. Most meats can be smoked on very low temp., and controlled with the flue on the back. Perfect for my wife and I. I old highly recommend the Masterbuilt 2 door propane smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Raksnis

customer_reviews.title: Good but runs hot
customer_reviews.text: Good room and cooks well! The only downside is that it burns hot, so it's difficult to keep it around ~225F. One way I found to reduce is to not ignite the wood until you've already loaded the meat. Otherwise, when you open the main door, the wood shavings get a lot of oxygen and burn up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: DJG

customer_reviews.title: Cheap BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this smoker with the intention of smoking turkeys. Since making the purchase we watch our local grocery ads and purchase boston butts for smoking. We can smoke our own meat for one half the cost of purchasing commercial BBQ. It is also fun experimenting with different rubs and injections for the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: mike hopson

customer_reviews.title: Great, Inexpensive Smoker
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive smoker that will cook some great food. I have done pork butt and ribs on it and no one complains at all about them coming off a cheap smoker. I bought an expensive pellet cooker because I have a problem with always wanting to upgrade. I can't say that my new smoker cooks any better than the Masterbuilt.
customer_reviews.author: the consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Easy to use!  Double check the price before you buy..
customer_reviews.text: Love the smoker! Works very well and easy to use. Easy to find recipes and instructions online. The only downside is that after buying this, and feeling like I got a good deal, I found the same one for about half the price in several other places. My advice is just to shop around and make sure you know what you want before you buy to make sure you're getting the best price!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Bent Latcches :(
customer_reviews.text: Both latches were bent when received. Rest of smoker looks great but useless without working latches.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: cook up whatever!!
customer_reviews.text: low and slow OR fast and hot this smoker can do it! would recommend cleaning out any ash or debris on a regular basis as the bottom where the flame dish sits tends to rust quickly if debris is left behind.
customer_reviews.author: Luckeelady

customer_reviews.title: Great smoker
customer_reviews.text: Bought as gift. Holds up great. Works exactly as it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Much improved.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a previous version of this smoker (single door, cast iron wood box). This product does hold the heat better and hotter. Had some trouble keeping the temperature low enough (170 to 200). Does start smoking the wood chips much faster. Easy to add more wood.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Good smoker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and control temperature. Decent amount of space to place food. No issues so far
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: My ribs are so good. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that you have fuel options. My favorite lately has been plain old fashioned charcoal. I load it up, fire up the propane for 5 minutes to get it going, turn off the propane and let the charcoal go for an hour. After an hour (at 225 -250), I reload and repeat the process. 4 hours later, perfect ribs are ready to eat!! I like this thing a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brenner

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The smoker is functional but lacks in sturdiness. When I put it together the doors didn't line up and there was no way to adjust the fit. The metal is then and can be bent much too easy. It smoked my food OK but the temp adjustment is very crude so you have to watch it a lot to make sure that you don't over cook the food. The cooking instructions seemed like they were for a different unit but since I have smoked before I make my own adjustments and it worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Gnax

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted :)
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I been wanting for years. I have used it a few times even tho its winter here. Works great. Just a note to wood chip size. Keep them as big as you thumb so they do not burn up to fast. The chips get so hot they super heat the cooker as they burn up after smoking for a wile.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: "Wish I needed two of these"
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what all I was getting but this has far exceeded my expectations. Have couple of friends with smokers that got me interested. I had never smoke things before. My expertise is BBQ. In 2 weeks I did a sit down dinner for 55 people of St. Louis style short ribs and they came out outstanding! I was very nervous going into it but "LOVE" this smoker. Amazon gave me bet price and excellent service on delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry T.

customer_reviews.title: Rough start but... Happy ending...
customer_reviews.text: The product works very well. I only gave it 4 stars because the original use I could not maintain temps below 300 degrees. I contacted customer support and they sent out a replacement hose/controller. Originally I had a blue/yellow flame with little difference between high and low. With the new hose/controller the range is exactly as expected from a smoker and the flame is blue as one would expect. The new controller is a better quality (all brass???) and hopefully Masterbuilt is shipping new units with this controller and not just waiting for complaints (many complaints on Amazon reviews!!!). Kudos to customer support and boos to Masterbuilt if they are shipping new units with the old controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne P.

product_meta.title: Masterbuilt 20051311 GS30D 2-Door Propane Smoker, 30" (Old Version), Black
product_meta.description: The rich, full flavor of slow-cooked food has been a staple of outdoor cookouts. The masterbuilt vertical gas smoker delivers smokehouse flavor as easy as grilling not only does this gas smoker come fully equipped with an electronic push button igniter, but it also has over 700 Square Inch of total cooking space on four chrome cooking racks. The porcelain coated wood chip tray and water pan are removable for easy clean-up. The built-in temperature gauge allows you to always know the temperature of the inside of the smoker and when it’s ideal to add certain foods. The smoker also has a stainless steel burner and type 1 regulator with hose. The cool touch wire handles is an added value because it allows you to open the door often without having to use protective hand accessories every time you want to check the cooking process. The locking door and the inner liner help to keep the heat and smoky flavor inside. The air damper allows better smoke control allowing you to have as much or as little smoky flavor you would like for your foods. Whether you’re cooking pork, chicken, beef or seafood, the delightfully smoky aroma that permeates from the masterbuilt vertical gas smoker with push button igniter has a way of making friends and family flock around the smoker in the spirit of good times and good food.
feature_bullets: Four chrome smoking racks with 717 square inch of cooking space
Stainless steel burner and type 1 regulator and hose
Porcelain-coated wood chip tray and water pan
Locking door with built-in temperature gauge and cool touch wire handle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars781 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
